page.title: 09ECOLOGICAL PROBLEMS
page.content: The rivers flowing through the area are the{Lostock, Yarrow and Sydbrook. The most{badly polluted}is the {Sydbrook.}The river Yarrow becomes more polluted as it flows through Croston. Near to the{sewage works traces of salt and oil were found in the water with some solid material. The river Lostock had a{clear bright appearance. In the river no trace of solid material was found. The{noise pollution}level in the centre of Croston is high. Many large commercial vehicles use the A581 as a {route between Liverpool and the M6 {motorway.
